reasoning: REM Sleep Behavior Disorder is a rare sleep disorder with estimated incidence of ~1.2 per 100k person-years and prevalence around 0.5-1% (500-1000 per 100k). Limited population-based epidemiological data; most estimates derived from sleep medicine literature and specialty clinic cohorts.
source: Schenck CH, Boeve BF, Mahowald MW. (2002). Delayed emergence of a parkinsonian disorder in 38% of older men initially diagnosed with idiopathic rapid eye movement sleep behaviour disorder. Neurology. 59(6):796-801
